list.title: Hair loss prevention
list.description: Get a head start if male pattern baldness runs in the family. Treatment can take time to work.

list.title: Thinning at the crown
list.description: When the growth phase of hair follicles shorten over time, androgenic alopecia can cause bald spots at the crown.

list.title: Receding hairline
list.description: Seeing more forehead as you age? It's related to the shortening of hair follicles' growth phase.

list.title: Thinning all over
list.description: It's common for hair follicles to close up when you age. It can be slowed down or stopped with the right treatment.

list.title: Why does it happen?
list.description: It happens when the penile erection chambers fail to generate and maintain the high pressures needed for a fully hard erection.

list.title: How common is ED?
list.description: It's more common than you think, and men are more likely to experience ED as they age.

list.title: Can ED medication help?
list.description: There are prescription medications -- PDE5 inhibitors, that are evidence-based treatments for ED.

list.title: What is PE?
list.description: When a man has difficulty delaying ejaculations or experience ejaculations that happen under 3 minutes.

list.title: Why does it happen?
list.description: There are many possible causes of PE -- physical causes, psychological causes or a combination of both.

list.title: Can PE medication help?
list.description: There are prescription medications which works by inhibiting serotonin transporter to help with delaying ejaculations.
